results.title: Data Science Product Manager
results.description:
Who we are, what we do & why we do it

We are Dext. Our suite of tools makes accountants more productive, profitable and powerful. In doing so we give them back the most precious commodity, time, which they can then use to add greater value to their clients.

Accountants and bookkeepers are the backbone of every successful business. For more than a decade we‚Äôve empowered our partners with innovative technology solutions to make businesses better. Dext allows them to meet the challenges they face today, tomorrow and in the future.

We are now seeking an experienced Product Manager to help with our continuous efforts to improve the level of automation we bring to our extraction processes.

The role (what you‚Äôll do):

  • Manage the data extraction lifecycle, you will be responsible for determining what 'success' looks like taking into consideration a number of macro and micro factors
  • Research new ways to improve our automation processes; working closely with our machine learning lead and lead data scientist on requirements, data capture, sampling..ultimately using the tools at your disposable to spot actionable insights
  • Channel the voice of the customer to ensure data outputs are in line with user goals
  • Evaluate and implement new product ideas
  • Work closely with the wider product team and stakeholders to align on product releases and team roadmaps
  • Ensure that stakeholder needs are considered and evaluated during the development stages

About you (what we are looking for):

  • Equally comfortable using reporting tools such as Looker, Snowflake, SQL as well as building simple data science models in a notebook.
  • Successful candidates in the past have come from a data science background or product analysts who have applied data science techniques.
  • Ideally previous Product Management experience in a fast-paced technology business. Some experience of advising/making product led decisions is needed.
  • Ideally, previous experience in a SaaS, rapid growth environment
  • Capable of making data driven decisions
  • Stakeholder management
  • Managing and prioritising a backlog

These are our ideal requirements, but we hire on potential, not just on experience, and we know that some people are less likely to apply for a role if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the criteria. At Dext we are committed to cultivating a diverse, inclusive and empowering culture, so please apply if you meet the majority of these competencies.

You can read more about our Diversity & Inclusion commitments here.

¬†

What you will be a part of:

We are a highly ambitious, innovative, market-leading FinTech. We are a global, well-funded business but have the dexterity and pace of a scale-up. We are uncompromising in our desire to achieve our best, day-in day-out, and we have three clear values which guide everything we do:

Be Brave - Everyone in the company has a voice to challenge ideas and the status quo.

Be Exceptional - We set high standards for ourselves. We aim to be exceptional at what we do.

Be Together - We are one team. There is no such thing as individual success without team success.

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Why customers love Secfix

Secfix automates security compliance for SMBs in Europe. We help companies get and stay compliant with standards such as ISO 27001, GDPR, TISAX, and SOC 2 in weeks rather than months.

Companies nowadays need these standards to win enterprise deals. However, it is a manual, error-prone and tedious process that takes at least 1 year. Our platform integrates with the companies‚Äô tech stack (like GCP, AWS, Azure, Google Workspaces, Jira, Gitlab, etc.), extracts the data needed for compliance, and creates a checklist to become and remain certified. That way we can automate many processes and companies can save 100s of engineering hours working on documentation and excel sheets.

The fastest company finished their compliance in 4 weeks with us.

¬†

Why join Secfix

In August 2021 we raised a Pre-Seed round from top angel investors (including the first Flixbus investors Heinz Raufer, Rheinhard Wick, and Torsten Sturm) to build our Minimal Certifiable Product (MCP). We launched MCP in Nov 2021 with a few startups and scale-ups as early customers. The product pull was so strong that we got to the first 10 customers just within the first weeks. Now Secfix operates in Germany, Austria, Portugal, Spain, UK, and Poland and is a trusted partner of major audit firms (certification bodies).

We‚Äôve recently raised a bigger seed round from leading VCs and investors to expand our product to more security standards, more languages and with the goal to become the category leader in Europe!

¬†

What‚Äôs exciting about Secfix is our Company Values:

  • We are obsessed with our customers. We start with the customer and work backward to create products they want.

  • We build smart. We love working by YCombinator's principles and we preach those in our team.

  • We create trust. Transparency and ethics are within our DNA.

  • We are hacky. A functional basic prototype delivered in 2 weeks is worth more than the perfect solution delivered in 2 months.

  • We take ownership. Building a startup is about ownership and being accountable for¬† timely delivery.

  • We are leaders of the remote. We are passionately building a culture where people can be productive working from anywhere.

¬†

About the role:

We're looking for a hungry and hard-working Chief of Staff to help us solve a wide variety of problems across the business and build culture. Any problem that our founding team faces becomes your problem. You'll get first-hand exposure to what it means to build and scale a startup.

¬†

Preferred experience and behaviours¬†

  • You take pride in delivering great outcomes.

  • You love speed. You have 4+ years of work experience in a fast-paced startup environment, scale-up, consultancy, VC, or complex larger technology organisation, ideally within an operational or people growth capacity.¬†

  • Past founder experience or close collaboration with founders is highly advantageous.¬†

  • You have experience in working and improving remote collaboration in the team.

  • You're passionate: you take pride in your work and how it can impact the mission we‚Äôre on.¬†

  • You are reliable & smart. You take pride in getting things done on time and have a clear, concise communication style. Using pragmatism, you help the founding team to make better decisions.

  • You‚Äôre a passionate entrepreneur with the ability to be hacky where needed to keep momentum.¬†

  • You are data-driven, analytical and have strong attention to detail.

  • You love automation, baking it into process wherever possible. Experience with Zapier is advantageous.

  • We believe in and appreciate radical candour, it forces us to be better!

  • You are a natural project manager. You can drive the future of the company with a growth mindset and creative pragmatism

  • You are creative and curious about new technologies and advancements.

  • You need to be able to work or learn fast to work with many modern tools like Zapier, Loom, Gather, Notion, Slack, etc. Knowledge of coding is a plus!

¬†

Responsibilities:

  • You‚Äôll wear multiple hats as a generalist, supporting the founders with day-to-day operations and leading impactful projects from hiring, people ops, business development, marketing, etc.

  • You‚Äôll be Head of Remote: We are a 100% remote company, which means we have to be creative in building a great culture. You‚Äôll help build and maintain our remote culture and support handbooks and processes. We love events so helping to organise virtual events, on-site and in cool locations. Gitlab is our inspiration.

  • You‚Äôll help design our recruitment operations and processes in collaboration with the founders.

  • Coordinating with the designers and the technology team, you‚Äôll help to deliver new features on our product roadmap

  • Work with the founders to influence design of the sales process and automation processes with Zapier, Linkedin Navigator, Apollo and new tools.

  • You‚Äôll take ownership of ad-hoc projects such as financial modelling, KPI planning, event organisation, compliance, creating fundraising decks, etc.

  • You‚Äôll play an interim owner role for different areas of the business, helping understand who we need to bring to take those areas forward.

  • Working with different business units, you'll find new ways to implement solutions to save time or cut costs. This includes the design and constant optimisation of internal structures and processes

Logistics: Remote UK-based role. The team is distributed across Germany and Europe.¬†¬†

¬†

What you can expect from Secfix:

  • We are backed by top VCs and accelerators. You can get direct access to world-class mentors.

  • Industry-Competitive base salary and generous equity package

  • Latest tech equipment. (MacBook, monitors, headphones)

  • 26 vacation days

  • Personal Development Budget of 1,000 EUR which includes headspace membership for mental health, gym membership and virtual team building

  • Have more ideas for perks? You can make them reality at Secfix üôÇ
